rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment reports the national scale of culling factually; 'kill' is not a high-potency verb in this context.
The segment uses a containment verb ('kill') which is neutral even with large numbers unless paired with vivid language, which is absent here.
The segment does not contain any questions.
This segment reports the scale of culling nationwide but contains no explicit calming language or cues.
The segment does not contain a minimiser token ('only', 'just', etc.) combined with a scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
The segment describes the impact/scale of the outbreak, not capabilities or preparedness.
'kill about 22 million birds' reports numerical impact using standard descriptive language.
